p.k: An intimate portrait of Warren Beatty, the Oscar-winning director and actor known for such films as Bonnie and Clyde, Reds and Heaven Can Wait
A fascinating look at the life and career of actor Jack Palance, best known for playing villainous roles in the 60s and for his award-winning appearance in City Slickers
From Mozart to Beethoven, this episode explores the people who shaped the sound of the Viennese classical scene. Featuring Diana Damrau and Lang Lang
Found in a bin bag, Princess Diana's black Emmanuel gown goes on sale. Plus late dealer Ambroise Vollard's collection finally comes up for auction
Competition in which budding artists are challenged to paint a scene in four hours
The Body The contestants arrive in Rome, where they are challenged to take pictures of the human body. Finnish photographer Elina Brotherus mentors
A Sad Loss Claire and her boyfriend have always counted on inheriting Claire's wealthy aunt's fortune. But when they hear she has a new heir lined
Clerical Error While winding up his late father's affairs, Paul finds a bill demanding over ?1,000 for pornography. He's suspicious of the claim. for a very good reason
76% Race Talented artists explore multiculturalism and race relations in the UK with thought-provoking short films, and a new national anthem by Nitin Sawhney

n.u: Ian McKellen: The South Bank Show Originals

p.n: Ian McKellen: The South Bank Show Originals V (3)
p.k: Melvyn Bragg looks back at Sir Ian McKellen's appearances on The South Bank Show, tracing his rise from the National Theatre to Hollywood stardom
An intimate portrait of Warren Beatty, the Oscar-winning director and actor known for such films as Bonnie and Clyde, Reds and Heaven Can Wait
A fascinating look at the life and career of actor Jack Palance, best known for playing villainous roles in the 60s and for his award-winning appearance in City Slickers
Heir Presumptuous George is murdered, and one of his nephews is seen fleeing the scene. The problem is his nephews are identical twins
Down Along And Sheltering Palms An ex-soldier meets a beautiful woman on a nostalgic trip back to his old base. But she isn't all she seems
New. A magical in-depth exploration of the city of Paris, from the rich culture to the hidden rivalry between two districts - the rebellious Montmartre

p.n: Pavarotti: Birth Of A Pop Star
p.k: New. The fascinating story of Luciano Pavarotti's journey from concert performer to international superstar as he helped expand the popularity of opera worldwide

p.n: Luciano Pavarotti: Legends of Opera I (1)
p.k: Critics, directors and singers celebrate the world's greatest opera stars, past and present, starting with the late great Italian tenor Luciano Pavarotti
A look at the life and career of American actor George C Scott. Despite winning an Oscar for his portrayal of George S Patton in 1970, he refused to accept the award
An intimate profile of Julie Christie, the acclaimed British actress who has won the Academy, Golden Globe, BAFTA and Screen Actors Guild awards

p.n: The Drawings Of Yves Saint Laurent
p.k: An incredible collection of Yves Saint Laurent's sketches are brought to life in a special look at the iconic designer's legacy. With YSL fashion tycoon Pierre Berge
Intriguing documentary exploring the mysterious 1890 disappearance of Leeds-based film pioneer Louis Le Prince, a man some believe was the true inventor of moving pictures
New. No Offense A look at how comedians and sitcom writers have found creative ways through euphemisms and innuendo to just about abide by the rules

p.n: California Dreamin' : The Songs Of The Mamas & The Papas
p.k: Interviews and performance footage tells the remarkable story of 1960s Californian pop group The Mamas and the Papas
The original members of Fairport Convention look back on the band's 50-year history and reflect on how they pioneered the British folk rock movement

p.n: Manic Street Preachers: Escape From History
p.k: Documentary by BAFTA-winning director Kieran Evans telling the story of how The Manic Street Preachers' acclaimed 1996 album Everything Must Go was created
A fascinating look at the making of John Lennon's debut solo album, Plastic Ono Band, which saw the former Beatle dealing with issues such as abandonment
